description.para: PicoTest follows the Semantic Versioning Specification (SemVer) 2.0.0:

briefdescription.para: Signature of test functions.

detaileddescription.para: Both Test Suites and Test Cases follow this signature.

parameterdescription.para: Test filtering condition, or NULL. In the former case, passed to the active test filter before running the test.

simplesect.para: Number of failed tests.

description.para: PicoTest provides a way for client code to select tests to be run using custom filter functions.

briefdescription.para: Define the test filter function.

detaileddescription.para: Called before calling a test with a non- NULL condition.

The default filter does a simple string equality test between its testName and cond arguments, and propagates to subtests if it doesn't match. Redefine this macro to use a custom filter function, which must follow the PicoTestFilterProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: filter.c Example of PicoTest test filter, allows custom filtering of test functions. tags.c Advanced example of PicoTest test filter, implements a primitive tagging feature for test filtering.

briefdescription.para: Test does not match the condition, skip this test and all its subtests.
Test matches the condition, run this test and all its subtests.
Test does not match the condition, skip this test but filter its subtests.
Test matches the condition, run this test but filter its subtests.
Result of test filter functions.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: filter.c Example of PicoTest test filter, allows custom filtering of test functions. tags.c Advanced example of PicoTest test filter, implements a primitive tagging feature for test filtering.

memberdef.definition: typedef PicoTestFilterResult() PicoTestFilterProc(PicoTestProc *test, const char *testName, const char *cond)
memberdef.name: PicoTestFilterProc

briefdescription.para: Signature of test filter functions.

detaileddescription.para: A test called with a non- NULL condition must match this condition to be run. The test filter is set using the PICOTEST_FILTER macro.

simplesect.para: a PicoTestFilterResult value

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: filter.c Example of PicoTest test filter, allows custom filtering of test functions. tags.c Advanced example of PicoTest test filter, implements a primitive tagging feature for test filtering.

description.para: Tests can form hierarchies of test suites and test cases. PicoTest provides a way to traverse such hierarchies with a simple visitor pattern. This can be used for e.g. test list discovery in build systems.

briefdescription.para: Traverse a test hierarchy.

parameterdescription.para: Test traversal proc. Must follow the PicoTestTraverseProc signature.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: traverse.c Example of PicoTest hierarchy traversal, prints traversed tests to stdout.

memberdef.definition: typedef void() PicoTestTraverseProc(const char *name, int nb)
memberdef.name: PicoTestTraverseProc

briefdescription.para: Function signature of test traversal proc.

parameterdescription.para: Number of subtests (zero for simple test cases, at least one for test suites).

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: traverse.c Example of PicoTest hierarchy traversal, prints traversed tests to stdout.

description.para: PicoTest provides a way for client code to intercept test failure events. This can be used for e.g. logging purpose or reporting.

briefdescription.para: Define the test failure log handler.

detaileddescription.para: Called when a test fails.
The default handler does nothing. Redefine this macro to use a custom handler, which must follow the PicoTestFailureLoggerProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: logger.c Example of PicoTest error logging, prints location and info of failed assertions to stdout.

memberdef.definition: typedef void() PicoTestFailureLoggerProc(const char *file, int line, const char *type, const char *test, const char *msg, va_list args)
memberdef.argsstring: (const char *file, int line, const char *type, const char *test, const char *msg, va_list args)
memberdef.name: PicoTestFailureLoggerProc

briefdescription.para: Function signature of test failure log handlers.

parameterdescription.para: File name where the test was defined.
Optional message format string, or NULL.
Optional message string parameter list, or NULL.

simplesect.para: msg and args are suitable arguments to vprintf().

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: logger.c Example of PicoTest error logging, prints location and info of failed assertions to stdout.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *file, int line, const char *type, const char *test, const char *msg, va_list args)
memberdef.name: picoTest_logFailure

briefdescription.para: Test case declaration.

detaileddescription.para: This macro defines a PicoTestProc of the given name that can be called directly.

parameterdescription.para: (optional) Name of the test fixture used by the test.
(optional) Fixture context structure defined using PICOTEST_FIXTURE_CONTEXT(_fixtureName).

simplesect.para: Number of failed tests.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: mainSuite.inc Example of a simple PicoTest suite.

description.para: PicoTest provides a way for client code to intercept test case events. This can be used for e.g. logging purpose or reporting.

briefdescription.para: Define the test case enter hook.

detaileddescription.para: The default hook does nothing. Redefine this macro to use a custom hook, which must follow the PicoTestCaseEnterProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: hooks.c Example of PicoTest hooks, prints all events to stdout.

detaileddescription.para: The default hook does nothing. Redefine this macro to use a custom hook, which must follow the PicoTestCaseLeaveProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

simplesect.para: hooks.c Example of PicoTest hooks, prints all events to stdout.

briefdescription.para: Function signature of test case enter hooks.

detaileddescription.para: Called before running the test case.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: hooks.c Example of PicoTest hooks, prints all events to stdout.

memberdef.definition: typedef void() PicoTestCaseLeaveProc(const char *testName, int fail)
memberdef.name: PicoTestCaseLeaveProc

briefdescription.para: Function signature of test case leave hooks.

detaileddescription.para: Called after running the test case.

parameterdescription.para: Failed tests (including its subtests if any).

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: hooks.c Example of PicoTest hooks, prints all events to stdout.

briefdescription.para: Hard assertion.

detaileddescription.para: Logs an error if the given value is false, then stops the test with PICOTEST_ABORT().
PICOTEST_FAILURE_LOGGER() is called with the type argument set to "ASSERT".

parameterdescription.para: Value to test. Evaluated once, so it can be an expression with side effects.

simplesect.para: msg and following arguments arguments are suitable arguments to printf().

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: mainSuite.inc Example of a simple PicoTest suite.

briefdescription.para: Soft assertion.

detaileddescription.para: Logs an error if the given value is false, but let the test continue.
PICOTEST_FAILURE_LOGGER() is called with the type argument set to "VERIFY".

parameterdescription.para: Value to test. Evaluated once, so it can be an expression with side effects.

simplesect.para: msg and following arguments arguments are suitable arguments to printf().

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: mainSuite.inc Example of a simple PicoTest suite.

briefdescription.para: Generic failure.

detaileddescription.para: PICOTEST_FAILURE_LOGGER() is called with the provided type, test and msg arguments.
This can be used to implement custom testing logic.

briefdescription.para: Abort a test case.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to implement custom testing logic.

memberdef.argsstring: (PicoTestFailureLoggerProc *proc, const char *file, int line, const char *type, int count, const char *test,...)
memberdef.name: picoTest_assertFailed

description.para: PicoTest provides a way for client code to intercept assertions events. This can be used for e.g. logging purpose or reporting.

briefdescription.para: Test suite declaration.

detaileddescription.para: A test suite is a test function that is made of one or several subtests.
This macro defines a PicoTestProc of the given name that can be called directly.

parameterdescription.para: Names of the subtests in the suite.

simplesect.para: Number of failed tests.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: mainSuite.inc Example of a simple PicoTest suite.

description.para: PicoTest provides a way for client code to intercept test execution events on test suites and their subtests. This can be used for e.g. logging purpose or reporting.

briefdescription.para: Define the test suite enter hook.

detaileddescription.para: The default hook does nothing. Redefine this macro to use a custom hook, which must follow the PicoTestSuiteEnterProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

simplesect.title: Examples
simplesect.para: hooks.c Example of PicoTest hooks, prints all events to stdout.

briefdescription.para: Define the test suite leave hook.

detaileddescription.para: Called after running all subtests.
The default hook does nothing. Redefine this macro to use a custom hook, which must follow the PicoTestSuiteLeaveProc signature.

simplesect.para: Custom functions only apply to the tests defined after the macro redefinition. As macros can be redefined several times, this means that different functions may apply for the same source.

briefdescription.para: This file defines a minimalist unit testing framework for C programs.

detaileddescription.para: The assertion mechanism relies on setjmp() / longjmp(). While these functions are discouraged for production code, their usage is acceptable in the context of unit testing: in our case, longjmp() is only called when an assertion fails, a situation where the actual process state is no longer reliable anyway. Moreover, they constitute the only standard exception handling mechanism for plain C code.
